title: Occasionally misleading error message with `Tensor` type checking.
body_html:
When a Tensor is created with an integer size, unless the integer type is specifically "int", the error message is:

TypeError: new(): data must be a sequence (got <type>)

Where <type> is the type of value passed to Tensor.

Examples:

import torch
import numpy as np

torch.Tensor(5)           # good
torch.Tensor(int(5))      # good
torch.Tensor(np.int32(5)) # error
torch.Tensor(np.int64(5)) # error
torch.Tensor(float(5))    # error

Perhaps a better message would be:

TypeError: new(): data must be a sequence or int (got <type>)
body_text:
When a Tensor is created with an integer size, unless the integer type is specifically "int", the error message is:
TypeError: new(): data must be a sequence (got <type>)

Where <type> is the type of value passed to Tensor.
Examples:
import torch
import numpy as np

torch.Tensor(5)           # good
torch.Tensor(int(5))      # good
torch.Tensor(np.int32(5)) # error
torch.Tensor(np.int64(5)) # error
torch.Tensor(float(5))    # error
Perhaps a better message would be:
TypeError: new(): data must be a sequence or int (got <type>)
body:
When a `Tensor` is created with an integer size, unless the integer type is specifically "int", the error message is:

```
TypeError: new(): data must be a sequence (got <type>)
```

Where `<type>` is the type of value passed to `Tensor`.

Examples:
```python
import torch
import numpy as np

torch.Tensor(5)           # good
torch.Tensor(int(5))      # good
torch.Tensor(np.int32(5)) # error
torch.Tensor(np.int64(5)) # error
torch.Tensor(float(5))    # error
```

Perhaps a better message would be:

```
TypeError: new(): data must be a sequence or int (got <type>)
```
